before.name: globalblocks
before.comment: A central table to store global blocks which are currently active.

columns.name: gb_id
columns.comment: Primary key

columns.name: gb_address
columns.comment: The target of the global block. An IP address, IP range, or account.

columns.name: gb_target_central_id
columns.comment: The central ID for the target of the global block. 0 if the target is an IP address or IP range.

columns.name: gb_by_central_id
columns.comment: The central ID for the performer of the global block. The central ID is the ID provided by the CentralIdLookup service.

columns.name: gb_by_wiki
columns.comment: The wiki where the block was performed, used to provide a link to the performer of the block on another wiki.

columns.name: gb_reason
columns.comment: The reason for the global block, provided by the performer of the block.

columns.name: gb_timestamp
columns.comment: The timestamp the block was applied.

columns.name: gb_anon_only
columns.comment: Whether the global block only targets anon users. If 1, then the block only applies to anon users.

columns.name: gb_expiry
columns.comment: The expiry timestamp for the block. Blocks can have an infinite expiry.

columns.name: gb_range_start
columns.comment: The first IP address in hexadecimal form for the range of IPs that is targeted by this block. For a block that targets a single IP this will be the same as gb_address but in hexadecimal form.

columns.name: gb_range_end
columns.comment: The last IP address in hexadecimal form for the range of IPs that is targeted by this block. For a block that targets a single IP this will be the same as gb_address but in hexadecimal form.

indexes.name: gb_address
indexes.comment: Used to find the block for a given target, such as on Special:GlobalBlockStatus or the API. The gb_anon_only column is included to allow callers to filter out blocks which are anon-only when searching by target. Also enforces that only one global block can be applied to a target.

indexes.name: gb_target_central_id
indexes.comment: Index used to lookup blocks for a given user (referenced by their central ID).

indexes.name: gb_range
indexes.comment: Index used to find range blocks where the IP of the current user is inside the range.

indexes.name: gb_timestamp
indexes.comment: Index used to filter for global blocks based on the timestamp they were applied.

indexes.name: gb_expiry
indexes.comment: Index used to find global blocks which have expired, and so should the row should be deleted from the table.
